DataElement.preferredName: Cytopenia Autoimmune Diseases and Disorders Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Performed Present Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the type of Cytopenia Autoimmune Disorder, a condition in which the body recognizes its own blood cells as foreign and directs an immune response against them, identified as the primary abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person specified as the reason for a clinical treatment in which HSC capable of reconstituting the immune system and blood production (hematopoiesis) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cytopenia Autoimmune Diseases and Disorders Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Performed Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to Cytopenia Autoimmune Disorder, a condition in which the body recognizes its own blood cells as foreign and directs an immune response against them, as the primary abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person specified as the reason for a clinical treatment in which HSC capable of reconstituting the immune system and blood production (hematopoiesis) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Cytopenia Autoimmune Disease Diseases and Disorders
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A reduction in the number of blood cells.:A condition in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: A laboratory test result indicating an abnormally low quantity of circulating blood cells.

A disorder resulting from loss of function or tissue destruction of an organ or multiple organs, arising from humoral or cellular immune responses of the individual to his own tissue constituents. It may be systemic (e.g., systemic lupus erythematosus), or organ specific, (e.g., thyroiditis).

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredName: Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Performed Present
Property.preferredDefinition: A clinical treatment in which HSC capable of reconstituting the immune system and blood production (hematopoiesis) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another. The donor and recipient may or may not be related. 2005:Performed; carried out.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A clinical treatment in which hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another.
Executed and carried through to completion.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
